availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Moses D. Vanhoose (Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Mary A. Vanhoose. Father of Elizabeth Vanhoose, Julia Vanhoose, Henry B. Vanhoose, Boyle Vanhoose, and James Vanhoose. Farmer in Johnson County in 1850. Farmer in Johnson County in1860. Private in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 108B. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Paintsville, p. 83. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Paintsville, p. 29. Organization Index to Pension Files of Veterans Who Served Between 1861 and 1900, NARA T289, Microfilm Series T289, Roll 623.
